solution_line_template: First find the total number of gates someone has to pass through: {total_floors} floors / {floors_per_gate} floors/gate = <<{total_floors}/{floors_per_gate}={num_gates}>>{num_gates} gates

Then find the total time someone spends waiting at the gates: {num_gates} gates * {time_per_gate_minutes} minutes/gate = <<{num_gates}*{time_per_gate_minutes}={total_wait_time_minutes}>>{total_wait_time_minutes} minutes

Then convert that time to seconds: {total_wait_time_minutes} minutes * {seconds_per_minute} seconds/minute = <<{total_wait_time_minutes}*{seconds_per_minute}={total_wait_time_seconds}>>{total_wait_time_seconds} seconds

Then find the time to drive through one floor in seconds: {distance_per_floor_feet} feet / {speed_feet_per_second} feet/second = <<{distance_per_floor_feet}/{speed_feet_per_second}={time_per_floor_seconds}>>{time_per_floor_seconds} seconds
Then multiply the time per floor by the number of floors to find the total driving time: {time_per_floor_seconds} seconds/floor * {total_floors} floors = {total_driving_time_seconds} seconds

Then add the total driving time to the total time waiting at the gates to find the total time to get to the bottom: {total_driving_time_seconds} seconds + {total_wait_time_seconds} seconds = <<{total_driving_time_seconds}+{total_wait_time_seconds}={total_time_to_bottom_seconds}>>{total_time_to_bottom_seconds} seconds
